actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to accelerate the scheduled increases in eligibility for individual retirement plans and to eliminate the marriage penalty in determining such eligibility.

summary.text: Marriage IRA Fairness Act of 2003 - Amends Internal Revenue Code provisions concerning retirement savings to: (1) increase, with respect to the limitation on the deduction for active participants in certain pension plans, the phaseout threshold to $50,000 (twice such amount on a joint return) and provide an annual cost-of-living adjustment; (2) increase the applicable dollar amount for a Roth IRA to $95,000 (twice such amount on a joint return); and (3) eliminate the marriage penalty on the IRA deduction for active pension plan participants.

titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to accelerate the scheduled increases in eligibility for individual retirement plans and to eliminate the marriage penalty in determining such eligibility.
